forumNotes.author: was_jaclaz
forumNotes.content:
Basically: * a "normal" PE CD/DVD uses as .iso bootsector an "El-Torito NO Emulation" image, usually called "Microsoft Corporation.img" or "Arnes Boot record" this bootsector loads: * \\I386\\SETUPLDR.BIN * \\I386\\BOOTFIX.BIN \<-this is the small file that causes the "Boot any key to boot from CD" message * SETUPLDR.BIN starts, read the .sif file (usually TXTSETUP.SIF) and goes one booting * the \\I386 path is hardcoded in SETUPLDR.BIN (and possibly in some other apps/plugins/links/whatever in a "normal" PE CD)
Have a look at the links I gave you, you need first to be able to create two out of three "normal" fully working builds NOT using the \\I386 path, say \\MYPE and \\DAPE, then we eill talk about combining the three builds together, by changing the "Arnes Boot record" with something else capable of loading different SETUPLDR.BIN's from different paths. We are talking at the moment about PE 1.x's i.e., like ERD 2005, Windows XP/Server 2003 based builds, right? ![:whistling:](http://reboot.pro/public/style_emoticons/default/happy22.gif) (the way PE 2.x (Vista/Server2008 based) and PE 3.x (Windows 7 based) boot/are built is different) jaclaz

forumNotes.author: wendy
forumNotes.content:
You could integrate these into a single PE disk.  

ERD2005 is in essence a set of applications that runs in PE, and can be launched from PE. BartPE shows this. You could launch this from a batch file from PE, i suppose. If i recall correctly, it writes data to the c:\\ drive, so you may want to use a RAM disk for the data settings.  

DAR i presume is a set of apps that are also added to PE. Enough is not known of this app to say what is needed here.  

You could have a single PE disk that has all of these apps on it, along with normal file utilities.   

For file management, ye need to configure your PE disk to use the local time zone, because this is what the target computers use.
